ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... If I intervene regularly, I can prevent someone from being hurt.
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... It is important for all community members to play a role in keeping everyone safe.
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... Friends will look up to me and admire me if I intervene.
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... I will feel like a leader in my community if I intervene.
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... I like thinking of myself as someone who helps others when I can.
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... Intervening would make my friends angry with me.
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... Intervening might cost me friendships.
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... I could get physically hurt by intervening.
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... I could make the wrong decision and intervene when nothing was wrong and feel embarrassed.
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... People might think I'm too sensitive and am overreacting to the situation.
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: How important is the following consequence when deciding whether or not to intervene in a situation where you thought someone might be being hurt or was at risk of being hurt... I could get in trouble by making the wrong decision about how to intervene
Notes: 1= Not important at all; 2= Slightly important; 3= Moderately important; 4= Very important; 5= Extremely important; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: Bystander Decisional Balance Scale (BDBS) - Pro / Positive-intervention motivators
Bystander Decisional Balance Scale (BDBS) - Con / Negative-intervention motivators

Notes: bdbs_pro minus bdbs_con; higher scores reflecting greater perceived benefits, relative to negative consequences, of bystander behavior
